alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Marion; Sequatchie (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 12:38PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Sequatchie, northeastern Marion and central Hamilton Counties through 230 PM EDT/130 PM CDT/... At 137 PM EDT/1237 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fairmount, or 7 miles south of Dunlap. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chattanooga, Soddy-Daisy, Signal Mountain, Walden, Lakesite, Whitwell, Fairmount, Red Bank, Powells Crossroads and Cartwright. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
